inputs.name: Edit this device
inputs.help_text: Allows editing Manufacturer, Category, and Operating System fields for a specific device. Overrides updates from the classifier if selected.

inputs.name: Edit all similar devices
inputs.help_text: Allows editing all devices with the same fingerprint. Updates the fingerprint used for profiling.

inputs.name: Submit a ticket
inputs.help_text: Copies the fingerprint of a device and sends it to Pulse Secure for reclassification if the device is incorrectly classified.

inputs.name: Override any updates by the profiler
inputs.help_text: Prevents updates from the classifier and ensures the selected profile is always used for the device.

actions.description: Allows administrators to override the approval status of a device, preventing automatic updates based on configuration changes.
Enables administrators to report incorrectly classified devices by submitting their fingerprints to Pulse Secure for verification and updates.

constraints.description: If a device is in an unapproved state, it remains unapproved regardless of updates.
Devices in a temporary-approved state revert to unapproved when the time-bound approval period ends.
If a device's category changes and the new category requires manual approval, the device status changes to unapproved.

errors.description: Occurs when a device is misclassified by the Profiler. Administrators can submit a ticket to resolve this.

steps: Enable the 'Override any updates by the profiler' checkbox.
Select the device with incorrect classification.
Copy the fingerprint and send it to Pulse Secure via email.

image_insights.insights: The screenshot shows options for managing devices, including editing device details, editing similar devices, submitting tickets for misclassified devices, and overriding updates by the profiler.
